channel.title: Half-Life for Dreamcast
channel.description: I just wanted to bring up the fact that Half-Life was intended to be released for the Dreamcast from Sega. I did manage to get my hands on the "beta" version, don't ask how :meh:, but it turns out the game was finished in every way! They scrapped it a few weeks from release and it not only includes Half-Life, but the HD pack and Blue Shift as well. There is a small problem with saving because the save file sizes differ depending on the level, and can be ridiculessly large. Anyway I just wanted to say that anyone who happens to own a Dreamcast, small chance, can pm me for a link to, erm "accuire" an iso.

item.title: Half-Life for Dreamcast
item.dc:creator: bulbman
item.description:
Jingles:

Wait, are you talking about TOB for the 360 or HL2 for XBOX original.

What do you mean by it being a “downsized version” and I always got a great frame rate and everything too.

EDIT: does it really matter that they removed a building and it didn’t seem empty for me at all.
Also TF2 is much better on console, more teamwork because of smaller teams, it is fairer due to none of the weapon updates, the only complaint I would have is missing goldrush.

Original XBOX, though my PC was shit at the time so I can’t really complain, I was just happy to play the game!

EDIT::ninja: You bastard.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life for Dreamcast
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
Jingles:

Wait, are you talking about TOB for the 360 or HL2 for XBOX original.

They said xBox, they mean xBox, not xBox 360.

Jingles:

Also TF2 is much better on console, more teamwork because of smaller teams, it is fairer due to none of the weapon updates, the only complaint I would have is missing goldrush.

I’m going to go ahead and say “Prepare for unforseen consequences” on that sentence.

sersoft:

I actually don’t like the x360 controller, I am using a sony dualshock clone made by logitech.

I was meaning the stealing part was like you.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life for Dreamcast
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Because it’s not the same game, it’s a downsized version and I just remembered something, the frame rate was terrible, sometimes the FPS dropped all the way to 10, I’m not even joking, I used a legit xbox and a legit version of hl2.

item.title: Half-Life for Dreamcast
item.dc:creator: Nedepp
item.description:
Door:

Make a media-center PC, say it’s for DVD’s and such to whomever you live with.

Then one night install Steam and HL1 on it and connect your Xbox 360 controller to it(If you don’t have one, steal one like Sersoft), sit back and play Half-Life.

My best friend’s dad did that once I think. I never thought you could do that until then. Thanks for giving sort of a tutorial.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life for Dreamcast
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
I think it is a good game on both pc and xbox, and the load times are about the same for me and the graphics are still fine - better than my computer and most of my settings are near high. Why does everybody hate the console port so much?

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life for Dreamcast
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I played it, it’s totally horrible, an insult to the game.

You thought hl2 had bad loading problems? They are alot worse in the xbox version. They added special rooms that don’t exist in the PC version simply because if the loading point was in an outdoor area the xbox would run out of memory.

And forget about high res textures, if I ran that version on PC you would say the game settings are “Models: low, Textures: Low, Shaders: None, Shittiness: Extreme”

Read full topic
